line_1: Love that's forc'd is harsh and sour:
Soon caught the verse wi' aspect sour,
line_2: An' did ilk feeble thought devour;

line_1: Nor rigid churchman, nor dissenter sour,
line_2: No slave to pride, no canting pimp to pow'r,

line_1: Give them the taste of sweet, and sour.
line_2: And by some secret poignant power

line_1: There view her loud, affected, scornful, sour,
line_2: Paining all others, and herself still more.

line_1: Nor long shall ye remain. With visage sour
line_2: And arm'd with cruel Law's coercive power,

line_1: "No nonsense of parsons, or methodists sour,
line_2: "Some books, prithee landlord, to pass a dull hour;

line_1: As Heav'n's blest Beam turns Vinegar more sow'r.
line_2: Reason itself but gives it edge and pow'r,

line_1: To keep, at times, frae being sour,
line_2: It's hardly in a body's pow'r,

line_1: The very apples now-a-days are sour!
line_2: 'Tis not so now; the sun has lost its power;

line_1: An' gif the custock's sweet or sour,
